title: Temporal Usage Patterns
insights:
Dataset Summary

The dataset contains a total of 44,031 events recorded from 499 users over a period from December 24, 2025 to January 20, 2026. There are 80 event types categorized under application events.

Temporal Usage Analysis

The analysis reveals the following key findings regarding user engagement patterns:

  • Peak Hour: 9 AM
  • Off-Peak Hour: 10 PM
  • Peak Day: Friday
  • Low Day: Tuesday
  • Peak-to-Trough Ratio: 42.7

PUSH NOTIFICATION TIMING

For maximum open rates, the marketing team should send push notifications during the peak hours of 9 AM on Fridays. This is when user engagement is at its highest, making it the optimal time for notifications.

CAPACITY PLANNING

The app requires maximum server capacity during the peak hour of 9 AM on Fridays. Given the high peak-to-trough ratio of 42.7, infrastructure should be prepared for significant traffic spikes during this time.

MARKETING WINDOWS

The best times for running in-app promotions or flash sales would be during the peak hour of 9 AM on Fridays. This period aligns with high user engagement, ensuring that promotional messages reach the largest audience effectively. Additionally, considering the off-peak hour of 10 PM, marketing efforts could also target this time for users who may be planning their next day’s travel.

WEEKEND VS WEEKDAY

The data does not provide explicit weekend vs weekday usage patterns; however, the peak day being Friday suggests a potential trend towards leisure travel as users prepare for weekend trips. The low engagement on Tuesdays indicates that this app may cater more to leisure travelers rather than strictly commuters, though further analysis would be needed to confirm user demographics.
